fields.description:
h3. Problem
When viewing an attached PDF on an issue, the highlighted part of the text was moved sideways and not pointing on where it should be. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a PDF file with a highlighted text on an issue
# Open the issue in IE 11

h3. Expected behaviour
The highlight marker of the text should be in place

h3. Actual behaviour
[^pdf.png]

h3. Environment
Windows OS
JIRA 7.1.9
IE11 browser

(!) Not reproducible in Chrome browser, JIRA 7.2 and JIRA 7.3.7 installations.
fields.summary: Highlight in PDF files are not Displayed Correctly when Viewed in IE11

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user enters a marked up text in the comment/description fields while the field is set to the *Visual* mode, JIRA should not mark up the text when it is submitted but rather treat it as a normal text.

For example, 
# If the user enters an image markup like 
{code}!something.png!{code}
JIRA should not mark this up as an image.
# If a user enters the any of the [Wiki Renderer|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] formatted text such as, enclosing a word with asterisks (*):
{code}
*this is a test*
{code}

h5. Expected Result

JIRA would show the exact text entered by the user (These examples are character escaped via Text mode):
# \!something.png\!
# \*this is a test\*

h5. Actual Result

# JIRA would attempt to markup the text and then show  an error:
{code}
Unable to render embedded object: File (something.png) not found.
{code}
# The second example:
*this is a test*

h5. Feature Request

*While in Visual mode*, _JIRA should be able to escape characters that are related to text which match the marked up parameters *automatically*_ or attempt to load the image and show the error below if the image is not present:
{code}
Unable to render embedded object: File (something.png) not found.
{code}

(i) When you use the Attach file button in the editor, the image is automatically loaded (it does not show the marked up text though)
fields.summary: Prevent JIRA from Parsing Text in Visual Mode

fields.description: As an admin, I would like to be able to change user/group preferences from his profile; specifically Language and Time Zone. It would be useful when they are having problems with it.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to change user/groups Preferences

fields.description:
When adding an EPIC Name, this can get more than the 10 filtered results.  There is a much higher likelihood that any epic to be linked is from _within_ the project being raised.

Would it be possible to first display epic matches within the project the issue is being raised, then list instance wise.  In this case when there are more than 10, it is likely the epic to be linked is in the drop down of suggestions.
fields.summary: Prioritise suggested epics from same project over instance wide

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The configured default issue type is never taken into account. The latest issue type used to create an issue is always set as the suggested choice even if you start a new session in a different browser or in an incognito windows.

This is not working as documented:
 # [Associating issue types with projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/associating-issue-types-with-projects-828787733.html]:
{quote}Set the Default Issue Type for the new scheme from the drop-down list. Please Note:
 * The 'default issue type' is the issue type displayed in the selection-box when a user creates an issue.
 * The issue types in this list depend on the issues in the Issue Types for Current Scheme list on the left.
 * The None option means that there is no default value. If this option is selected, the system will show the first Issue Type listed in the Issue Types for Current Scheme.
 * The Issue Type is remembered as long as you keep creating issues in the same project. Once you change projects or log off the system, it goes back to the default value.{quote}
 # [How to change the default issue type displayed at the Create Issue screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-change-the-default-issue-type-displayed-at-the-create-issue-screen-707986896.html]
{quote} * The next time the user creates an new Issue, the last issue type used will be displayed. -----JRASERVER-30620----- - Setting Default Issue Type to "None" Ignored RESOLVED
 * Once a user has created an issue in a project in the current session, JIRA retains the issue type from the previous issue any time the user creates a new issue in the same project. This is intended to make it easier for users to quickly create issues, such as when a software developer is creating a number of stories for a sprint or a QA engineer is filing bugs.{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 projects (e.g. SPA and KPA) having 2 different issue type schemes associated
 # Modify the issue type scheme of SPA to have default issue types set as *Bug* and move it to the top of the list
 # Modify the issue type scheme of KPA to have default issue types set as *Task* and move it to the top of the list
 # The result looks as below:
 !Default issue types config.png|thumbnail!
 # Click on create... see that the default issue type is not taken into account (by default you get KPA as the project and *Bug* as the selected issue type, see below screenshot):
   !First issue ever created.png|thumbnail!
 # Create an issue type *Story* in SPA
 # Click on *Create* to create a new issue. Select KPA. See that *Story* is selected by default. Create a *Story* in KPA as well
 # Log out.
 # Open a new browser or an incognito window and log into the instance again.
 # Click on the *Create* button

h3. Expected Results

The default issue type for the project is selected
h3. Actual Results

The issue type used in the previous session is selected (*Story*). Please notice that also what happened in Step #5 is not working as documented.
 !New-session-incognito-window.png|thumbnail!


h3. Notes
This behavior reproduces consistently and has been tested on clean installations of JIRA 7.2.9 and 7.3.6.
The only time the default issue type is taken into account is when, for example:
# You create an issue in Project A of type e.g. *Task*
# You create a new issue and select Project B
# The issue type *Task* does not exist in Project B and therefore the default issue type is selected instead

h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: The default issue type is not taken into account

fields.description:
h3. Definition
In some cases where dropdown custom fields need to have same set of options availability, it would be lessen manual work of recreating these options again if we can copy over the custom field options to another dropdown field

fields.description:

fields.description:
Hi -

I was wondering if it would be possible to be able to add multiple links at once through the More > Link action? *(Multiple URL links not Issue links)*

It is important to add all links through More > Link from a reporting standpoint, which makes individually adding a large list of pages inefficient.

As an example, for the reporting to account for all the pages that are linked in this JIRA ([https://jira.cerner.com/browse/IPDOC-37089]) I would have to add them one by one through More > Link.

Please let me know if this would be possible or if there is already a way to add multiple page links at once through More > Link.

Thanks!
Katarina
fields.summary: Request to Add Multiple Links through More > Link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user exists in multiple user directories with the same credentials, if the first directory is unavailable during a login attempt, but authentication is successful using a subsequent directory, the "Login Count" shown on the Users page will still increment even though the associated directory is the unavailable one.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add two LDAP connectors with a user that has the same username and password in both.
 # Make the first directory unavailable to JIRA
 # Login using the user that's in both directories

h3. Expected Results

Login details in {{⚙ (Administration) > User Management > Users}} indicates that the user has never logged in using the first directory.
h3. Actual Results

The login details are updated, incrementing the *Count* for the first directory, while the count for the second directory (which was used to authenticate) shows "Never Logged In" (visible if you alter the User Directory ordering or active/inactive status).
h5. two directories listed in order at login-time

!directories_list.png|thumbnail!
h5. details from first directory

!directory_1.png|thumbnail!
h5. details from second directory

!directory_2.png|thumbnail!

In the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file, you'll see something like this:
{noformat}
2017-06-08 14:00:09,202 http-nio-8080-exec-4 ERROR anonymous 839x126x1 71vlzg 172.16.83.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [c.a.c.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric] Directory 'LDAP server' is not functional during authentication of 'opendj1'. Skipped.
{noformat}
Examining JIRA's database, specifically the {{cwd_user_attributes}} table, we see that {{login.count}} has been incremented for the first directory, while the {{lastAuthenticated}} is stored for the second directory.
{noformat}
jira736=# select cu.lower_user_name, cu.active, cu.updated_date, cua.id, cua.user_id, cua.directory_id, cua.attribute_name, cua.attribute_value from cwd_user_attributes as cua join cwd_user as cu on cua.user_id = cu.id where cu.lower_user_name like 'opendj1';                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
 lower_user_name | active |        updated_date        |  id   | user_id | directory_id |      attribute_name      | attribute_value 
-----------------+--------+----------------------------+-------+---------+--------------+--------------------------+-----------------
 opendj1         |      1 | 2017-06-08 14:00:09.272-07 | 11200 |   11201 |        10301 | invalidPasswordAttempts  | 0
 opendj1         |      1 | 2017-06-08 14:00:09.272-07 | 11201 |   11201 |        10301 | lastAuthenticated        | 1496955609284
 opendj1         |      1 | 2017-06-08 14:00:09.272-07 | 11202 |   11201 |        10301 | autoGroupsAdded          | true
 opendj1         |      1 | 2017-06-08 13:47:41.733-07 | 11203 |   11200 |        10300 | login.currentFailedCount | 0
 opendj1         |      1 | 2017-06-08 13:47:41.733-07 | 11204 |   11200 |        10300 | login.lastLoginMillis    | 1496955609511
 opendj1         |      1 | 2017-06-08 13:47:41.733-07 | 11205 |   11200 |        10300 | login.count              | 1
(6 rows){noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA login count can increment incorrectly when primary user directory unavailable

fields.description:
Summary

The change in time doesn't appear to be happening at the right time for the (GMT-04:00) Santiago timezone.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to GSAC
 # Change profile timezone to (GMT-04:00) Santiago
 # Make an comment or update

h3. Expected Results

The time changes for the Santiago, Chile timezone should be the second Saturday of May(to GMT-4) and the second Saturday of August(to GMT-3).  
h3. Actual Results

The time is behaving like (GMT-03:00)
h3. Workaround

Set timezone to any other (GMT-04:00) option
fields.summary: Santiago, Chile timezone changes don't happen correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If for some reason JIRA loses connection with the LDAP Server during a directory synchronisation, depending on the stage, the users lose their memberships.

So it would be good for JIRA Administrators if JIRA rollback if the process fails in the middle and return to the previous state.

*This is not an easy scenario to reproduce as you will need to cut the connection with the LDAP server in a very specific step of the sync.*

h3. Expected results

JIRA continues to work without any problems.

h3. Actual results

The failed sync can leave JIRA in an unusable state if all users lose membership.
fields.summary: Rollback User Directory Modifications if Connection is Lost During Sync

fields.description:
When a browser window is on a JIRA page without being logged in, if you have entered your username/password (even automatically by a password manager), closing the page will trigger a prompt generated by the page saying "Are you sure you want to leave this page?"

If I have a browser session with several such tabs open and then quit my browser or close the window, I will get a prompt for each tab that must be handled before the browser closes.

The login form shouldn't be treated like other editable forms within JIRA in this respect.

For what it's worth, Stash/Bitbucket does not produce a prompt in this situation.

This is occurring on JIRA v7.3.6.
fields.summary: closing a login page with filled-in credentials without logging in should not trigger a prompt

h3. Summary
Non-Admin CSV import doesn't import child value of cascade select list


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of Type *Select List (cascade)*
# Set an option like Parent value: USA, Child value: New York
# Create a CSV to import cascade data following the docs like:
{code}
Summary, My Cascading Custom Field
Example Summary, USA -> New York
{code}
# Go to {{Issues(Menu) > Import Issues from CSV}}
# Import the CSV to a project with the cascade field

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be created and the cascade field information should be successfully imported

h3. Actual Results
The issue is created. However, only the parent value is added. The child value is not imported.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Chrome 58 and later release requires subjectAlternativeName (SAN) extension as per [https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2017/03/chrome-58-deprecations#remove_support_for_commonname_matching_in_certificates]

Please see related links on the changes
 * [https://www.thesslstore.com/blog/security-changes-in-chrome-58/]
 * [https://communities.ca.com/thread/241776307]

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the documentation at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-861253906.html] to share steps on
 * How to generate certificate with subjectAlternativeName extension using [Keystore Explorer|http://keystore-explorer.org/index.html]
 ** Portecle doesn't seem to support adding subjectAlternativeName on creation
 * How to generate certificate with subjectAlternativeName extension via Command line
 ** Reference; [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33827789/self-signed-certificate-dnsname-components-must-begin-with-a-letter]

h3. Why this is important

Chrome will throw an error on certificate generated without subjectAlternativeName extension. Other browsers will soon follow
fields.summary: Update Running JIRA applications over SSL or HTTPS documentation

fields.description:
As of recently, when a user creates a new filter, the visibility of the filter is set to Private by default, which can be annoying at times, especially when a user creates and shares multiple filters on a daily basis.

We believe it would be more appropriate to set the visibility of filters within the organization to JIRA Users, as it would allow creating, changing and sharing them instantly.

Thank you for your consideration!
fields.summary: Change privacy of Jira Filters

fields.description:
Some implementations use a customization to automatically populate fields based on the issue type that is selected in the Create Issue screen.  By default, if you select an issue type in the Create Issue screen, enter field values, then switch to a different issue type, all of the field values persist.  If some of these fields were automatically populated, it would be desirable if the fields would not persist in this use case.  

It is understood that many/most JIRA users would desire for their entered data to persist through an issue type change.  So our suggestion is to add a property whereby administrators can individually select how this functionality behaves.  

Thanks
fields.summary: Property to enable clearing all fields when changing issue type in create screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem.
Different methods of attaching a screenshot in JIRA results to an inconsistent MIME type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce the issue
A. Scenario A. 
# Open an issue
# Capture a screenshot and save it to the clipboard by pressing Ctrl + PrtScn keys in Windows
# Click anywhere within an issue detail page
# Press Command + V to show the *Attach Screenshot* screen
# Click Upload

B. Scenario B.
# Open an issue
# Capture a screenshot and save it to the clipboard by pressing Ctrl + PrtScn keys in Windows
# Click on either Description or Comment field
# Press Command + V to paste the image

h3. Expected behaviour
The MIME Type should be the same regardless of the method you attach the screenshot.

h3. Actual behaviour
* Scenario A
The MIME type is image/png
* Scenario B
* The MIME type is text/plain
!Screen Shot 2017-06-06 at 21.35.18.png|thumbnail!


(!) NOTES:
* Screenshots attached in both scenarios A and B can be viewed in Chrome without any issue.
* Screenshots attached using scenario B can't be viewed in IE 11. It appears to be a broken image.

h3. Environment 
Windows
JIRA 7.3.7
fields.summary: Inconsistent MIME Type when Attaching a Screenshot in JIRA

Please refer the below link for NFS supports. It says “NFS mounts are *not supported* due to Lucene requirements. Please see the [IndexWriter|https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__lucene.apache.org_core_3-5F2-5F0_api_all_org_apache_lucene_index_IndexWriter.html-23deletionPolicy&d=DwMFaQ&c=pK0m1Y2YHijnQdgo_W0o4Q&r=4UrHFcpI31F33l9PNSTfRx5tUU_cGrUfqicrC4oFx0s&m=oYkzKbUPqZbNS1gT5kxJ8fBXO_ZcRyxBNcN3q8tYKfA&s=47V5kkUpEtTQIdMrSoJgtsNYiKr5he6RTIvCVKA3GM4&e=] docs for more information”.

*[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/supported-platforms-828787550.html|https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__confluence.atlassian.com_adminjiraserver072_supported-2Dplatforms-2D828787550.html&d=DwMFaQ&c=pK0m1Y2YHijnQdgo_W0o4Q&r=4UrHFcpI31F33l9PNSTfRx5tUU_cGrUfqicrC4oFx0s&m=oYkzKbUPqZbNS1gT5kxJ8fBXO_ZcRyxBNcN3q8tYKfA&s=W5AKAbMfNRV9faVmJlnuYZ-_h9oIN4cwUF2zWFyesV8&e=]*

 

*2. It says supported.*

Jira Datacenter documentation itself talks about NFS:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/installing-jira-data-center-802592197.html|https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__confluence.atlassian.com_adminjiraserver071_installing-2Djira-2Ddata-2Dcenter-2D802592197.html&d=DwMFaQ&c=pK0m1Y2YHijnQdgo_W0o4Q&r=fxKsEUAO0vAoM92ohCXMXA&m=apBN9RHryvM-HF3-h98NpCaHftrqUsMzx6uCnlTGS_A&s=XHbvMQ4IxAY5_5-jmudUoVCjGtL7rFYbfZnAj_NABi4&e=]

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing JIRA with 7.1.9 using Internet Explorer 11, dragging the scroll bar to find a user in the assignee drop down will cause the picker to become unresponsive.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access JIRA using Internet Explorer 11 (replicated with versions 11.0.9600.18665 and 11.0.9600.18666).
# Navigate to a issue.
# Click on the *Assignee* field and try to locate a username by dragging the scroll bar with the mouse.

h3. Expected Results

User will be loaded progressively on the picker and you will be able to click on a user to set it as the assignee.

h3. Actual Results

By dragging the bar, no users besides those loaded when you first clicked on the field will load. You will also be unable to click on a user to select it.
 
h3.Workaround

Scrolling down with the mouse wheel does not presents this issue, the picker will work as expected. Also, searching for the user name by typing it will work as well.
fields.summary: Assignee dropdown defective on IE 11

fields.description:
Currently in our Organization Projects will have Program Increment(PI) with duration of  6 sprints of 2 weeks each and each PI will have Start Date and End date where Sprints should fall under this PI dates only.

 PI-1

       Sprint 1

       Sprint 2

       Sprint 3

        Sprint 4    . . . .

PI-2

     Sprint 7

     Sprint 8

     Sprint 9

    Sprint 10 . . . . .

etc...

so each PI will have 6 sprints, *where we need to associate each issue to a Sprint of  specific PI and scrum master can move Issue across Sprints of specific PI of Current Project only.*

can we have below feature in JIRA where.?

{color:#ff0000}*1)Associate Issue type to specific Sprint of PI of same Project, no cross project association*{color}

{color:#ff0000}*2) Feature to support Program Increment(PI) in JIRA with Sprints under that.*{color}

{color:#ff0000}*3) To move Issues  from Sprint of one PI to Sprint of other PI.*{color}

{color:#ff0000}*4) Tight coupling with PI dates and Sprint Dates.*{color}

    example. if 6 Sprints are created in  PI1, new sprint creation should automatically fall under PI2. with sprint dates automatically being filled for 2 weeks.

 

please check and revert back with you suggestions and inputs to venugopal.s@philips.com

 

Thanks,

VenuS
fields.summary: Feature to have Program Increment,Sprint planning and customization

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The notification email generated by the cloning an issue always shows the reporter of the issue as having "created an issue".

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create and issue with User A as the assignee and User B as the reporter
# As User C clone the issue.
# Look at notification emails sent to User A

h3. Expected Results
Notification shows reporter as User B, assignee as User A and says "User C created an issue" at the top.

h3. Actual Results
Notification shows reporter as User B, assignee as User A and says "User B created an issue" at the top even though the from name is User C:
 !Screen Shot 2017-06-01 at 7.20.02 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Note the from in the screen shot is "Admin User" while the email shows "Jennifer Evans created an issue"
fields.summary: Notification on clone of issue always has reporter as the creator of the issue even if another user did the cloning

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.0.1 on a server without any internet access 
# upgrade to version 7.2.x 

h3. Environment
* jira-healthcheck-plugin ver 2.1.11+

h3. Expected behaviour
JIRA should startup correctly.

fields.description:
h5. Problem
User with no groups or permissions is being seen as an "Assignable User".

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an user - do not add user to any groups or in any roles
* Modifying a permission scheme to have "Applicaton User - Any Logged in User"
** Remove all other grants
* Notice that the Permission Helper still detects the user as assignable

h5. Expected Results
User does not have access to JIRA and thus would not be shown as an assignable user

*Note*
This relates to another problem where incoming mail can be assigned to to this user:
* JRASERVER-39992
* JRASERVER-64990

h5. Workaround
* Remove "Applicaton User - Any Logged in User" from the Assignable Permission
* Add "Applicaton User - JIRA Software", "Applicaton User - JIRA Service Desk", etc.
fields.summary: Permission Helper Incorrect Shows Users As Being Assignable User

fields.description:
h3. Environment

To reproduce this JIRA to be configured to allow downgrades. I.e. property jira.downgrade.allowed is set to true. E.g. defined as -Djira.downgrade.allowed=true in Java arguments for JIRA in setenv.sh
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Install and start JIRA 7.3.6, pass the setup wizard.
 # Stop JIRA 7.3.6.
 # Install JIRA 7.3.5, make it point to the JIRA home used for 7.3.6
 # Start JIRA 7.3.5.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA fails to start. Shows communication message like:
{quote}unexpected error occured while trying to downgrade.
 Database build number: 73016
 JIRA app build number: 73016
{quote}
Same information is shown in JIRA logs, also exception and traces are captured in logs too.

 
h3. Expected Results

If JIRA has no upgrade tasks, JIRA should be able to downgrade.

 

(!) Generally downgrades are not recommend, as JIRA and plug-ins may have upgrade tasks that are irreversible.

(!) Downgrading JIRA may corrupt your data.
fields.summary: JIRA can fails to downgrade with jira.downgrade.allowed=true

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If an organization with a lot of groups (100s) is attempting to add groups to the application access page, the fact they have to do this one at a time makes it difficult because they need to wait for JIRA to reload after adding each group which can be time consuming.

h5. Feature Request

Can a functionality similar to the one used to add users to groups be added to JIRA which allows adding multiple groups to the application access at a time?

h5. Existing Behavior

Users would need to add groups one at a time.
fields.summary: Allow Bulk Add Group to Application Access

fields.description:
h2. Reproduction
 * You put a lot of effort into the creation of a ticket.
 * You incidentally cause a browser-back event.

h2. Result
 * There is no warning, but the ticket is just lost!
 * An incidental browser back event is quite likely on browsers using Trackpad gestures.
 * Today it happened 4 times attempting to write the very same ticket, which lost me an hour of work, which motivated me to finally report it.

h2. Expected
 * JIRA behave as Confluence already does:
 * There is a Javascript warning popup, giving you the chance to really go back and discard the draft, or to return and continue working.

 
h2. Workarounds
h3. Disable gesture or hotkey which could incidentially cause the back event.
 * *Problem*: Quite a global change only to overcome one particular web app's behavior.

h3. Enable a userscript which is active for {color:#f79232}your.domain.com/jira/*{color} and triggered if you go back from the creation issue URL.
 * *Problem 1*: Hard to match the issue creation URL.
 ** The button "CREATE" causes an overlay of the currently viewed JIRA page, which can be any URL.
 ** Only the particular issue creation URL {color:#f79232}*/jira/secure/CreateIssue*{color} can easily be matched clearly.
 * *Problem 2*: Exact event matching (go back or close window) was so far not possible for me. Real Javascript developers surely can do this properly.
fields.summary: On browser back JIRA discards my drafted issue without any warning

*What it is now:* getFieldScreenLayoutItem(int poistion)
*What is should be:* getFieldScreenLayoutItem(int position) 
(i) Spelling error in the word _position_

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently we do not have any official documentation for data type definition for JIRA Server, it would be to great it as customer are interested to know on this information in order to perform some customisation accordingly.
fields.summary: data type definition for JIRA Server

fields.description: when moving an issue type from one workflow to another, workflow association error occurs and unable to change the workflow. Few issues are shown as cause of the problem with error message "*Unable to determine the current issue type for issue*" but when searched they are not available. Integrity checking is not able to catch those issues neither it can solve the problem. What can be the reason and how to resolve it ASAP?
fields.summary: workflow association error

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Σ progress field calculate progress using the following formula:
{code}
time spent
---------------------------- x 100%
(time spent + remaining time)
{code}

In some countries (German, for example), there are laws on collecting data of employees performance, that requires the ones who use JIRA to disable the log work. This means, customer will update the remaining time instead of entering time spent. 

In this use case, the Σ progress field will not show progress.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option that Σ progress field will show progress when remaining estimate is being modified, without time spent (log work is disabled)
fields.summary: Having the option for Σ progress field to support progress when log work is disabled

fields.description:
*+Problem Definition+*
 JIRA Default Max Memory of 768M is too low.

*+Suggested Solution+*
 Set the Default Max Memory to 1G.

*+Why this is important+*
 Most of the time, the default max memory is too low for customer and often they hit into slowness.

+*Workaround*+
 Increase the max memory manually.
fields.summary: JIRA Default Max Memory of 768M is too low

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Sometimes any operations on the index, for example searching, will cease functioning. In the logs there will be an error like:

{code:none}
org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException: this IndexReader is closed
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader.ensureOpen(IndexReader.java:263)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader.decRef(IndexReader.java:237)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher$SearcherCloser.decReaderRef(DelayClos
{code}

h4. Cause

The org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException exception is not being handled correctly. 

h4. Workaround

One of the following will get it working again:

# Restart JIRA
# Do a full locking re-index
fields.summary: Operations utilizing the Lucene index fail due to mishandling of org.apache.lucene.store.AlreadyClosedException error

fields.description: I'd like to be able to expand an issue inline
fields.summary: Inline expansion of List View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When customer tried to deploy JIRA using AWS Cloudformation template for JIRA datacenter he was not able to provide custom options to JIRA through the CatalinaOpts template parameter.

h3. Environment
* AWS Cloudformation deployment 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# follow the steps in the [JIRA datacenter quick start reference  | https://s3.amazonaws.com/quickstart-reference/atlassian/jira/latest/doc/jira-software-data-center-on-the-aws-cloud.pdf]
# When providing the template parameters, try to pass any Java or tomcat options like:
CatalinaOpts  -Xmx4096m

h3. Expected Results
JIRA process should pick up the options and use them

h3. Actual Results
JIRA just uses its default configuration and no changes happen to the process.
Even editing the parameter default value in the AWS cloudformation template doesn't work.


h3.Workaround
* Modify the option manually after the JIRA data center is deployed using a script.
* Modify the Atlassian AWS template to change the values in JIRA setenv.sh.
fields.summary: JIRA DataCenter AWS template not picking up CatalinaOpts

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian developers!

Could you please add two small options for JIRA? 
Right now we have JIRA v7.1.9. 
I have some troubles with navigation in our big structure with long names of issues and I would like to see small hints in JIRA:

1. In top of issue I would like to see the path with Summary names of parental issues (not just PRJCTNM / PRJCTNM-#####, but the full/cropped path).
 2. In the Structure part I would like to see pop-up tip when I put the mouse cursor over a line with long name, which not fit to Structure area. 
 
 I've draw it in screenshots :)
 
 Thank you in advance!
fields.summary: Full text path to issue at the top of page and pop-up hint in Structure plug-in for long names

Events are sorted by time.
h4. Actual Behaviour

Events are sorted by id(some late events might be on top of more recent)
fields.summary: Audit log incorrectly sorts DC events

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA's Export to Word functionality to export an issue produces a HTML file but is renamed under the ".doc" extension as mentioned in JRASERVER-38174. 

This is known to cause some issues with certain office suites, such as DocuSign. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the Export to Word functionality to export issues in a pure ".doc" format.
fields.summary: JIRA's Word Export should export in a pure doc format instead of HTML.

fields.description:
This is actually a two part request:
#  Correct the information in older documentation for Integrating JIRA applications with IIS ([7.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Integrating+JIRA+applications+with+IIS], [7.2|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Integrating+JIRA+applications+with+IIS]): 
** The problem isn't that URLs are too long, but that URL _segments_ are too long
** The default is 260 rather than 200 (see also: [Http.sys registry settings for Windows|https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/820129/http.sys-registry-settings-for-windows])
# Add this information to our [7.3 documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Integrating+JIRA+applications+with+IIS], as it does not appear to have been included there.
fields.summary: Update JIRA IIS integration guide to include troubleshooting for UrlSegmentMaxLength

fields.description:
The current docs we have in regards to JIRA using Oracle database do not go into the different editions offered by Oracle.  

However the Express edition has limitations in regards to the size of the database itself, as well as the system resources that can be allocated to it.   


{quote}
Oracle Database XE can be installed on any size machine with any number of CPUs, stores up to 4GB of user data, using up to 1GB of memory, and using only one CPU on the host machine. 
{quote}
[Oracle Database Editions|https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/license.111/b28287/editions.htm#DBLIC110] has more details.

Because of this limitation our products like JIRA and Confluence can reach these limitations in large customer environments and cause performance limitations within our products because of this.   I expect this was the same logic in regards to why the MS SQL Express editions are also not listed on the supported platforms.  They have very similar limitations in regards to how large the database can be, and I think there is a 1GB memory limitation there as well.


Requesting to update the JIRA supported platforms docs to reflect that we should not be supporting environments using the express editions.
[JIRA 7.3 Supported platforms - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Supported+platforms]
fields.summary: JIRA Supported platforms documentation regarding Oracle Database Express edition

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a user is transitioning an issue to a step whose workflow property contains *jira.issue.editable=false*, if an attachment is added in the transition screen, it would fail to be added to the issue once the issue is created.

h5. Steps to  Reproduce

# Create a JIRA project(suggest a Project Management workflow as it is easy and I would be using it for the example).
# Edit the newly created project's workflow.
# Add a screen which has the attachment field to the transition from _To Do_ to _In Progress_.
# Select the step _In Progress_ and in the pop-up, select properties.
# Add the property value {{jira.issue.editable=false}}.
# Publish the workflow.
# Create an issue in the new project.
# Transition the issue from _To Do_ to _In Progress_ using the _Start Progress_ Transition.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would add the attachment to the issue similar to how it added the comment and other field updates.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA would add all other updates and silently drop the attachment.

h5. Observation

Removing the property from the step ensures that the attachments can be added again.
fields.summary: Attachments not Added Due to Workflow Property

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When creating a subtask, if the user tries to use the inherited parents' attachments via _Description_ field function "attachment", it will show the file as included in the textbox, but after creating the issue, for most file types, it will just add the file name as text, and not the file. For png files it will just add the error:
{code}
Unable to render embedded object: File (filename.png) not found
{code}

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a parent Issue including one or more attachments.
# Create SubTask from said issue. 
# At the screen for Subtask creation, go to the _Description_ field and using the Attachment function (Screen1.png) select one or more attachments, the thumbnail(if image) or filename as a link (if a text file) will be shown in the text area (Screen02.png).
# Fill other necesary fields and Create SubTask.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would show the image or file attached to the subtask.

h5. Actual Behavior

No attachment is added and at the Description of the Subtask, a render error is shown (If the file is an image, Screen3.png) or just a text with the filename instead of the actual files.

h5. Cause
Unknown.

h5. Workaround
Download the parent issue's attachments and attaching them as any regular attachment at the subtask creation screen.

h5. Notes:
# Browser independent (tested in Chrome 58, Firefox 52 and MS Edge 40).
# Tested with different filenames, different lenghts, with and without "-" or any special symbols.
fields.summary: Creating a Subtask using the parents' attachment(s) does not work

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

Currently, JIRA allows you to create users via the External system import functionality and having the user associated with a user field like assignee or reporter.

However, these only import the user's username and require that you add the other properties later on following the import.

h5. Feature Request

Can a functionality be added into JIRA so that users can be directly created by importing a CSV file which contains all details for each user?

For example:
{code}
username, first name, last name, email address, groups
user1, john, doe, jdoe@mymy.com, "jira-users, jira-administrators"
{code}

Should create a user with matching name and user name and automatically add the user to the groups specified in the CSV file.

(!) _A similar functionality is currently present in the CLI plugin._
fields.summary: Allow Creation of User via CSV

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading first JIRA Core then JIRA Software, a 500 error is thrown when browsing the projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a JIRA Core 7.3.0 instance, install the JIRA Software application 7.3.0.
# Create a JIRA Software project.
# Use the rapid upgrade method to upgrade JIRA Core to 7.3.6.
# Upgrade JIRA Software to 7.3.6 via *JIRA Administration > Applications > Versions & licenses*.
# After the upgrade is complete, try to browse the project created in step 2.

JIRA opens the project without any issue.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When opening audit log settings in new page page layout is corrupted:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to System > Audit Log
# Open "three dots" menu and open "Audit Log Settings" link in new tab
# A new tab with settings and corrupted layout will be show

h3. Expected Results
A page with styling simmilar to dialog version

h3. Actual Results
A page without applied page styling

h3.Workaround
Open settings as a dialog:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Audit log settings layout is corrupted when opening in new tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing JIRA without logging in, *Dashboard* drop down button does not have *Manage Dashboard* link. But user is able to access {{<Base URL>/secure/ConfigurePortalPages.jspa?view=popular}} directly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access *Manage Dashboard* directly by using this URL; {{<Base URL>/secure/ConfigurePortalPages.jspa?view=popular}}.
 # User will be able to see Dashboards that are Public.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to access the page from the UI (not by entering URL) to access all the Public dashboard.
h3. Actual Results

The user needs to manually navigate to the URL to access this page.
h3. Notes

This applies to {{<Base URL>/secure/*ManageFilters*.jspa?filterView=popular}} as well
h3. Workaround
 # Shutdown JIRA
 # Edit the *actions.xml* located in the {{JIRA-INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes}} directory
 # Modify the file from:
{code:xml}
    <action name="filter.ManageFilters" alias="ManageFilters">
        <view name="success">/secure/views/filter/managefilters.jsp</view>
        <view name="contentonly">/secure/views/filter/managefilters-content.jsp</view>
        <view name="securitybreach">/secure/views/securitybreach.jsp</view>
        <view name="error">/secure/views/filter/managefilters.jsp</view>
    </action>
{code}
to:
{code:xml}
    <action name="filter.ManageFilters" alias="ManageFilters" roles-required="use">
        <view name="success">/secure/views/filter/managefilters.jsp</view>
        <view name="contentonly">/secure/views/filter/managefilters-content.jsp</view>
        <view name="securitybreach">/secure/views/securitybreach.jsp</view>
        <view name="error">/secure/views/filter/managefilters.jsp</view>
    </action>
{code}
(i) Added the *_roles-required="use"_*

 # Restart JIRA
 # Repeat the steps for {{alias="ConfigurePortalPages">}}
fields.summary: Anonymous user is unable to access Manage Dashboard page via UI

fields.description:
When we try to access the document  [Administering Bitbucket and GitHub with JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/administering-bitbucket-and-github-with-jira-applications-802592223.html] we got a blank page. It blinks and then nothing is displayed.

!Screen Shot 2017-05-29 at 6.28.27 PM.png!
fields.summary: Blank page in the document Administering Bitbucket and GitHub with JIRA applications

fields.description:
Currently in JIRA the function of a custom field is determined by the field type.
It should be determined by usage not by type.
For example Not all people fields are necessarily actual users of our Jira server.
Also not all jira users are necessarily "real people".
Also with same analogy, not every date field would contain an actual start or a finish date and doesn't necessarily correspond to a date relevant to the issue or the project, thus makes no sense to list under the dates section of the issue detail view.
currently the only way around this is to use general purpose text fields for custom fields which is not useful.
It would be better to define a function attribute and give the option to group based on the function.
fields.summary: Create a new field function attribute to classify issue fields.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if user count is close to reaching the license limit, JIRA will show a warning like:

{quote}
You are X users away from the maximum allowed by your license.
{quote} 

in Versions and Licensing page. This can be confusing to some users since the user license is not exceeded.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option to hide the warning.


h3. Workaround 

None. Admins can choose to ignore the warning since they have not exceeded the user count.
fields.summary: Show users warning only when user count is exceed

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

Starting up JIRA and accessing it on the browser immediately before the startup is completed shows an icon with 2 balls juggling. This icon is broken in *Internet Explorer 11* browser.

(i) _This worked well in Chrome and Firefox when we tested._

!upload.png|thumbnail!
h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Startup JIRA.
 # Immediately access JIRA on IE 11 browser.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would show the logo correctly and the animated juggling balls would work correctly.
h5. Actual Behavior

The icon would appear broken which can be confusing for some users who assume something is wrong with JIRA.

h4. Workaround

Use Chrome or Firefox
fields.summary: JIRA Loading Logo Broken when starting up via IE 11

fields.description: When managing components you have the option to delete component and you are present with the ability to swap to a different component. Would be nice to be able to set different component in a different project (so tickets get moved to a different project also).
fields.summary: Add ability to change to component in different project

fields.description: Test suggestion
fields.summary: Testing 456

fields.description:
h5. Description
As stated by World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) on [HTTP/1.1: Header Field Definitions|http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.19], The ETag response-header field provides the current value of the entity tag for the requested variant. This can improve the network performance of web applications.

h5. Suggestion
Implement the support for ETag headers on JIRA Rest API calls.
fields.summary: Support ETags in JIRA Rest API

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

When the audit_log grows very large (24 million+ rows in my testing) searching the audit log (System -> Troubleshooting and Support -> Audit Log) for specific text or date ranges will fail with a message stating "There was an error loading data".

!Screen Shot 2017-05-26 at 2.24.25 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Generate 24 million rows of audit log data, e.g.:
{code:java}
INSERT INTO audit_log (id, remote_address, created, author_key, summary, category, object_type, object_id, object_name, object_parent_id, object_parent_name, author_type, event_source_name, description, long_description, search_field)
SELECT x.id, '10.0.0.1', '2017-01-01 07:35:11', '', 'Group created', 'group management', 'GROUP', '', 'jira-software-users', '1', 'JIRA Internal Directory', 0, '', '', '', '10.0.0.1 group created management jira-software-users jira internal directory' || x.id
FROM generate_series(200000,24200000) AS x(id);{code}
 

Then attempt to search for a date range or a specific string.

h3. Additional Detail

The audit log table can rapidly grow quite large due to -JRASERVER-39094-. While that issue is now corrected the past audit log entries are already present in the table.

h3. Workaround
Problem is mitigated with [auditing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/audit-log-improvements-989762528.html] made in Jira 8.8

* Truncate the audit_log table to fewer than 24 million rows.
* See other workarounds in JRASERVER-67985
fields.summary: Audit log searches fail when audit_log table is large

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an instance has a good amount custom fields. It can be hard to audit and tell what fields are actually being used. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a way either via JQL or in the custom field portion of the application to audit usage.
fields.summary: Auditing for custom field usage.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there isn't a method via the API or native function in general that allows you to bulk delete custom field values. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create an API end point or in app function that allows you to bulk delete custom field values. 

h3. Why this is important
 Reduces customer friction in maintaining custom fields. 

h3. Workaround 
Use [Custom field editor|https://codeclou.io/customfield-editor-plugin/1.3.0/rest-api/] plugin to create an API script to do so.
fields.summary: Bulk delete custom field values.

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
It's currently possible to add a single user to a group via REST API using [POST /rest/api/2/group/user|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/group-addUserToGroup]. However, this must be called multiple times if you intend to add multiple users to a group

h3. Suggestion
Update the endpoint to be able to add multiple users in a single REST call
fields.summary: Add multiple users to group via REST API
Allow hyperlinks to be disabled on issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Comment invisible when pasting from Outlook to IE 11
h3. Environment
 * Windows 7
 * Internet Explorer 11
 * Outlook 2016
 * JIRA 7.3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue
 # Click on *Comment*
 # Make sure the *Visual* mode is selected
 # Start typing any text and then hit *Cancel*
 # Copy a text from an Outlook email
 # Make sure the *Visual* mode is selected
 # Paste the comment from Outlook email (the comment pasted is invisible)
!invisible.png|thumbnail!
 # Click at the *Text* mode
 # The comment will be shown
!visible.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The comment should be visible when pasting a content from Outlook emails
h3. Actual Results

Text is invisible until you switch to *Text* mode at the comment field.
  
h3. Workaround

You can use Chrome or Firefox to workaround this issue
fields.summary: Comment invisible when pasting from Outlook to IE 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Under normal circumstances, when viewing a dashboard that you did not favorite will trigger the "This dashboard is not available in your Dashboard menu. To add it to the Dashboard menu, you need to add it as a favourite on the Manage Dashboards page." popup message dialog to appear. However the popup would not appear if JIRA is set to German.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the Default Language to German from the general configuration settings if isn't already configured to be German.
# From the top menu bar, select *Dashboards* > *Manage Dashboards* (*Startseite* and *Dashboards verwalten* respectively in German)
# Search for a Dashboard that is not part of your favorites yet.
# Access the Dashboard.

h3. Expected Results
A German equivalent of the "This dashboard is not available in your Dashboard menu. To add it to the Dashboard menu, you need to add it as a favourite on the Manage Dashboards page." popup message dialog will appear.

h3. Actual Results
No popup appears.

h3. Notes
Tested with Russian as well but a Russian popup dialog will appear.
fields.summary: The "This dashboard is not available in your Dashboard menu" pop-up does not appear when using the German language.
REST API to return more details when creating new issue

fields.description:
Is it possible to obtain the Fix version in to the “Ticket Links” table in Jira tickets.

Since we are copying to multiple paths having the fix version in the links table itself will make things easy

!1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Requesting Fix Version to be appeared on Ticket Links table

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30371].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 11 January 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

CORS has been supported in the JIRA REST API since JIRA 6.0 for JIRA Server. If you are a JIRA Server customer, simply go to the "Whitelist" section of JIRA Administration and add the domains you wish to request resources from. *Note:* You must have the System Administrator global permission to access this section of JIRA administration.

Unfortunately, this domain whitelist is not available in JIRA Cloud for security reasons. We haven't yet been able to spend time developing a pattern for supporting this in JIRA Cloud, but we do intend to work on this at some point in the future.

I have updated the issue summary to more accurately reflect the current status of this feature.

Regards,

Dave Meyer
 [dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
 Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
JIRA REST API documentation ([http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#authentication]) says: ... if you are using JIRA in a browser you can call REST from Javascript on the page and rely on the authentication that the browser has established.

However it does not work, see my example [http://jsfiddle.net/avalez/nCcq9/2/] and others complains: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/69356/cross-origin-resource-sharing-with-jira-rest-api-and-javascript]

Looks like Access-Control-Allow-Origin response header is missing.

CAUTION, to make it really work for remote clients, it's necessary to respond with exact match for host name in Access-Control-Allow-Origin header, see related AMKT-3342 ([https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-3342]).
fields.summary: Allow cross-domain requests for CORS

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA installer silently fails to create dedicated JIRA user if {{jira}} group already exists.

h3. Environment
* Linux
* Tested with JIRA Software 7.0.11, 7.2.8, and 7.3.6 installers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a clean Linux environment to install JIRA
# Create a group called {{jira}}
# Run the JIRA installer and install JIRA

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will startup normally.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA does not start.  If you attempt to invoke it manually with {{start-jira.sh}} or something to the effect of {{service jira start}}, you will see the following:
{noformat}
To run JIRA in the foreground, start the server with start-jira.sh -fg
executing using dedicated user: jira
runuser: user jira does not exist
root@ghs83027:/opt/atlassian/jira/logs# {noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Manually create the appropriate user afterwards and update permissions/ownership as needed.

As an alternative, remove the pre-existing group and re-perform the installation.
fields.summary: Linux JIRA installer fails to create user if group already exists

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using the Import your Data XML restore method on a new JIRA installation, JIRA should check the backup version to see if this version is compatible to upgrade


h3. Suggested Solution
It would help if the XML import methods would make a check against the version of JIRA this backup was created from and prevent the user from continuing when we know there is a high degree of either JIRA or Agile/JSD being able to update the customer's data successfully.   I created a screenshot with the type of dialog box to provide some feedback to the customer in regards to why we should not be able to upgrade this.

!upgrayedcheck.png|thumbnail!


h3. Why this is important
Currently JIRA does not check the version number listed in the backup that indicates what version of JIRA created this backup before it tries to then run any/all upgrade tasks on this older data.  This is a real problem for any JIRA instance running JIRA Server 6.4.x or before with Service Desk (any version) when going to any version of JIRA 7.2.0 or higher, and/or JIRA Agile 6.3.xx.x or before when trying to go to JIRA Software 7.1.0 or higher.

Granted these are add-ons to JIRA, but our own [Skipping major versions when upgrading JIRA applications - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/skipping-major-versions-when-upgrading-jira-applications-802592265.html] indicates that all users should be upgrading JIRA versions from 6.4.x and before to a 7.0.x version.   The problem is many users still don't know this information.   It would be helpful if JIRA actively prevented upgrade attempts / XML restore attempts when detecting that the backup comes from a much older version of JIRA that should not be attempted to upgrade that data directly.
fields.summary: When using the Import your Data XML restore method on a new JIRA installation, JIRA should check the backup version to see if this version is compatible to upgrade
Update password policy to include space as a special character.

fields.description:
Over the last 5+ years we have received ongoing concerns from many of our users about JIRA's inability to retain and present the HTML tables, URLs, email addresses etc from the body of emails in the JIRA issues.  When a HTML table with multiple rows and columns is converted to text format in the JIRA issue it is often illegible.  Marek Sandomierski from our JIRA team has recently noticed that this shortcoming has been resolved in JIRA Service Desk. Will this ever be fixed in JIRA Core?

[Explanation provided by Marek Sandomierski]

Generally the request concerns a problem on how JIRA mail handler deals with formatted text in the body of the email (HTML tables, URLs, email addresses etc). 
 
 Currently the JIRA Mail Handler converts everything from email body into plain text before entering it to the ticket description and therefore reading some information that was included in the table is almost impossible - this is known issue and it was raised very often by our customers. 
 Generally the description field allows some special formatting (wiki markup) so there should be some option to provide the input not only in plain text but also in wiki markup. 
 
 Few months ago I was testing JIRA Service Desk and to my surprise email sent to JIRA with formatted table went through and format was kept (it was actually converted to wiki markup not a plain text). 
 
 I did some research and it turnes our that Matthew McMahon, fixed this for JIRA Service Desk Mail handler (different mail handler then used by JIRA Core/Software). Therefore it is fixed for this product but not for JIRA Core/Software. 
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1942 
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3296 
 
 It was raised for JIRA Core/Software product, however it was closed w/o any significant input. 
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20987
fields.summary: Formatted text from email should be retained in JIRA issue description field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A down arrow appears next to the last sub-task in the Issue Details view for the parent task.  If you click on the down arrow the screen reloads with an error "Cannot move sub-task when current sequence is unset"

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.6
* Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue (IT-1)
# Create several sub-tasks (IT-2, IT-3, IT-4)
# Navigate to the issue details screen for the first issue (IT-1)
# In the sub-tasks section, hover above the last sub-task (IT-4) to show the arrows on the right side
# Click the Down arrow

h3. Expected Results
The down arrow should not appear

h3. Actual Results

The down arrow appears and clicking it results in the page reloading with this error:
{noformat}
Cannot move sub-task when current sequence is unset
If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The up arrow does not appear on the first sub-task, behaviour should be similar for the last sub-task
fields.summary: Down arrow appears for last sub-task on issue view, clicking it triggers error

If a user wants to restrict the fix versions options shown per project, it is impossible as the field is set to be project wide. Hence, irrespective of what issue type they select, all fix versions for the project would be shown as selectable options.

h5. Feature Request

Can a context be made available to fix version so the project admin can use this to specify which fix versions are available to a specific issue type?

fields.description:
h3. Code block breaks ordered list when saving comments

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Start a new comment.
# Create a numbered list with multiple line items.
# In one or more line items in the numbered list, include a code block. 
# If using visual editor, notice that there is one contiguous numbered list.

Example:

{code}
# line 1
# line 2 (include a code block here)
# line 3
# line 4
{code}

h3. Expected Results

Only one numbered list is created, as seen in the visual editor.

h3. Actual Results

Multiple separate numbered lists are created. (If using visual editor, what you see is not what you get.)

h3. Workaround

Edit the comment and save with text editor selected. 

h3. Notes 

Video attached.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

User would face an issue where after creating issue the pop up screen is not showing or sometimes getting an error that the issue is missing.
h3. Suggestion

If possible, JIRA are coded to re-add "Re-Index Issue" post function to every initial transition or create an integrity checker to re-add the transition back if any workflow didn't add it to avoid the following problem:
 - [No New Issues of a Certain Type Are Searchable Until Reindex|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/no-new-issues-of-a-certain-type-are-searchable-until-reindex-779160870.html]
 - Avoid any [HealthCheck: Lucene Search Indexes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/healthcheck-lucene-search-indexes-740263412.html] to be happen.
fields.summary: Add "Re-Index Issue" post function to every initial transition

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently *activeUsersCountForLicense* cache can be populated for some time (see JRASERVER-64384). This will cause whole JIRA to stall, there is not visible indication of the problem. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce 1 minute timeout for cache population and optionally async cache update. 

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Add activeUsersCountForLicense cache population timeout

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue Types created by project blueprints are created in the default system language.  If this language is not english, then the issues are not translated to the users profile language.  This does work if the project is created with english as the default system language.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.6 (likely 6.4+)
* Spanish set as default system language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change default system language to Spanish
# Create a new JIRA Software or JIRA Service Desk project
# Change user profile language to English
# Go to create issue for the new project

h3. Expected Results
Translated Issue Types should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Only the Spanish is displayed as JIRA seems to only map English to other languages and not the reverse. 

h3.Workaround
Initially, create a template project with the default language set to English.  Then change the default language and use "create with shared configuration" to duplicate the projects created earlier in English.
fields.summary: Issue types for projects created with a non-english default language are not internationalized

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA if we want to have multiple incoming mail handler we will need to make sure to use different incoming mail for each project or use different folders in one incoming mailbox.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to configure a rule for incoming mail in whereby all replied email can go to one incoming mailbox and comments are added to respective projects issues based on the issue key. 

h3. Why this is important
Currently, when we use one single incoming mail address with different folders, we will need to configure the rule definition in mail server which causes lots of overhead configuration.
fields.summary: Rule Based Incoming Mail

fields.description:
When user add "Update Date is 20/March" filter in the Activity Steam gadget, some issue activities are not showing but only happen to be shown when the issue get updated.

The update date should be following the logic below:
{quote}Apparently, inside of gadget condition 'updated is 20/Mar/2017' is translated to JQL query:
 (created >= '5.03.17 00:00' AND created <= '20.03.17 23:59') OR (updated >= '20.03.17 00:00' AND updated <= '20.03.17 23:59')
{quote}
h3. Steps to reproduce it
 # Login JIRA
 # In the dashboard, create the following gadgets and add the filters below:
 ** Gadget A: Update Date is 5/March/2017 and issue key is ABC-1101 (not showing data)
 ** Gadget B: Update Date is 20/March/2017 and issue key is ABC-1101 (not showing data)
 ** Gadget C: Update Date is 23/March/2017 and issue key is ABC-1101 (showing data) because the issue detail view updated date is 23.03.17 10:18 (/)
 # Edit the issue (ABC-1101) by adding a label.
 # Refresh the dashboard again. You will see:
 ** Gadget A: Update Date is 5/March/2017 and issue key is ABC-1101 (is showing data)
 ** Gadget B: Update Date is 20/March/2017 and issue key is ABC-1101 (is showing data)
 ** Gadget C: Update Date is 23/March/2017 and issue key is ABC-1101 (remained the same)
 ** The issue update date should be your current date.

(i) Can't reproduce in a fresh instance.
h3. Actual behaviour

After editing an issue, the issue activities will be shown in the gadget.
 If you edit 10 more issues, activities will disappear. (assuming you have limit=10 in gadget)
h3. Expected behaviour

The issue activity is shown only if its' updateDate satisfies date filter.
h3. Workaround

Workaround would be get the issue updated by editing the issue.
fields.summary: Activity Stream gadget is not showing all activities

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Upgrade to JIRA is breaking boards using the NOT with WAS IN JQL operators in their filter


h3. Environment
* Problem appears to happen on environments upgrading from 7.1.x (or possibly earlier versions) to 7.2/7.3 versions


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.1.9, with JIRA Software
# Create a saved filter with the operators "NOT" that precedes the  "WAS IN" (here is an example {code:borderStyle=solid}
"project = ABC AND NOT (Status was in (Done, Resolved) before -30d AND status in (Done, Resolved)) AND assignee = user1 ORDER BY Rank ASC" 
{code}
# Create a new board based off this saved filter
# upgrade JIRA to 7.2.8 or 7.3.x



h3. Expected Results
JIRA is able to load these boards as expected



h3. Actual Results
# Trying to use the issue navigator when using both "NOT" and "WAS IN" in the same JQL query throws an error !result in 73x.PNG|thumbnail!
# You are unable to list all the boards in JIRA when going to Boards -> View all boards. (The system just appears to spin and wait forever)
# JIRA throws a 500 page error when tried to either visit the problem board directly, or even trying to visit the associated project landing page 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Technical details
Log's referral number: 95768191-b294-4121-bb17-df48bdb9c09a
Cause
Referer URL: http://localhost:8080/plugins/servlet/project-config/ABC/roles
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unrecognized operator: WAS_IN
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unrecognized operator: WAS_IN
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.forward(DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.java:55) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.forwardSafely(DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.java:83) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.SanitizingServletForwarder.forwardSafely(SanitizingServletForwarder.java:48) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.RememberingServletForwarder.forwardSafely(RememberingServletForwarder.java:75) 
{code}
 
h3. Notes
* This query works in JIRA 7.1.x and before !result in 71x.PNG|thumbnail!
* The error appears to include an underscore in the operator {{Unrecognized operator: WAS_IN}}, however when looking at the SQL data there does not appear to be an underscore in the query at all.   Hence there must be some other check/validation process within JIRA that is either adding this underscore, or is incorrectly checking for the valid operator of "WAS IN". 
* [Advanced searching - operators reference - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver073/advanced-searching-operators-reference-861256239.html#Advancedsearching-operatorsreference-WAS_INWASIN] still list {{WAS IN}} as a valid operator.
* However instead I think we should be using the {{[WAS NOT IN|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver073/advanced-searching-operators-reference-861256239.html#Advancedsearching-operatorsreference-WAS_NOT_INWASNOTIN]}} operator here, rather than trying to negate the current WAS IN operator


h3.Workaround
# You can find the filters in your environment that are using this with a query such as {code:borderStyle=solid}
select * from searchrequest where reqcontent like '%was in%' and reqcontent like '%not%'; 
{code}
# It would be best to create a [backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/backing-up-data-185729581.html] of your data before doing anything else
# You will need to edit the filter query within SQL in order to change the JQL query.  It would be best for you to note the current values for these filters now.  
*Old JQL query*: {code:borderStyle=solid}
project = ABC AND NOT (Status was in (Done, Resolved) before -30d AND status in (Done, Resolved)) AND assignee = user1 ORDER BY Rank ASC 
{code}
*New JQL query*:{code:borderStyle=solid}
project = ABC AND (Status was not in (Done, Resolved) before -30d AND status not in (Done, Resolved)) AND assignee = user1 ORDER BY Rank ASC 
{code}   You could do this with a SQL query such as {code:borderStyle=solid}update searchrequest set reqcontent='project = ABC AND (Status was not in (Done, Resolved) before -30d AND status not in (Done, Resolved)) AND assignee = user1 ORDER BY Rank ASC' where id=99999; 
{code} (where the id 99999 value is the id value of the filter returned in the first sql select statement)
# with the filter changed in SQL, restart JIRA
# This should allow the boards to load correctly.
fields.summary: Upgrade to JIRA is breaking boards using the NOT with WAS IN JQL operators in their filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding an image to the description field in earlier versions of Chrome (or any other browser type), you are able to resize the image simply by clicking on it.  In the latest version of Chrome, 58.0.3029.110 (64-bit), this does not work.  When you click on the image in Chrome 58, you do not get the resize boxes.
h3. Environment

I have tested at the latest JIRA version, 7.3.6

Also, the customer's version 7.3.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy random image from anywhere(I used a JPG), and paste into the description field of a created issue.
 # Click on the image, and nothing happens

h3. Expected Results

You expect to see the resizing boxes surrounding the image allowing you to resize it.
h3. Actual Results

No resizing boxes appear
h3. Notes

This appears to be an issue specific to Chrome 58.  
h3. Workaround

You can click on and drag the image slightly.  Alternatively in some instances, you can click outside of the Description field and then back onto the image to get the resize boxes to appear.  The first option tends to work more consistently.
fields.summary: When adding an image in description field it is difficult to resize in Chrome 58.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
In some cases, JIRA would not be able to startup due to a specific plugin that is installed in the instance. Then, we would need to startup the instance by moving the plugins out of the {{installed-plugins}} folder manually before starting up JIRA to make sure that the instance at least is accessible.

This is the current steps to start JIRA in safe mode:
# Stop JIRA
# Navigate to _JIRA Home folder > plugins_
# Rename the {{installed-plugins}} to anything else.
# This will make JIRA create the folder again but, without any plugin inside.
# Start JIRA.

Then, nothing will be initialized as the folder empty and JIRA starts in safe mode. But, this is not exactly simple to perform.

h3. Suggested Solution
To have a specific flag that will make JIRA to startup in safe mode without making changes in that folder.

h3. Note on fix
Starting from Jira 7.3 there are 2 new start-up options:
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
--disable-all-addons (or /disablealladdons for windows users)
--disable-addons=<addon keys> or (/disableaddons=<addon keys> for windows users)
{code}
* *disable-all-addons* does not disable all addons, but merely only those that are non-system (i.e marketplace addons, or custom addons), in some places this is referred to as "user-installed".
* *disable-addons* takes a colon-separated list (chosen as a colon is the only prohibited character from a plugin key) of addons to be disabled. These can be system addons. 
**  be used to disable JIRA application OBR bundles, i.e
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
./bin/start-jira.sh --disable-addons=com.atlassian.jira.jira-software-application
{code}
* As of 7.3 these features *does not* work in Datacenter mode, the parameters are ignored if present when JIRA is configured to work in a cluster.
fields.summary: Add ability to disable Jira add-ons at start time

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When JIRA generates many cache flush events (see JRASERVER-64839), flushes for _activeUsersCountForLicense_ cache are blocking and stack (wait) for each other. 

h3. Expected Results
Caches are not blocking

h3. Actual Results
Thread dump, thread trying to flush the cache: com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.removeAll
{noformat}
"http-nio-8080-exec-828" #365452 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fda18083000 nid=0x38e0 waiting on condition [0x00007fde368df000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x000000055b994878> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$FairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$WriteLock.lock(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:943)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.removeAll(LoadingCache.java:320)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.removeAll(DelegatingCache.java:148)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.clearUserCounts(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:651)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.onGroupMembershipCreated(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:510)
....
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This is fix only for specific cache {{activeUsersCountForLicense}}. See related JRASERVER-64847  for all caches. 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Flushes for activeUsersCountForLicense cache are blocking

fields.description:
I have seen a couple suggestions to be able to disable the Automatic assignee. This is really what I want so that the user is forced to choose an assignee when creating an issue. For some reason this has been deemed as won't fix.

If we cannot have that, can we have a validator that could be used to not accept Automatic? This would still be slightly annoying for the user that forgets to change the assignee but at least it would not result in numerous issues automatically going to the project owner.
fields.summary: Add validator to check for "Automatic" assignee

fields.description:
The current docs we have for connecting JIRA to Postgres - [Connecting JIRA applications to PostgreSQL - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/connecting-jira-applications-to-postgresql-861253040.html] - do not provide sufficient information for users that are setting up postgres on another server.

There are details needed in regards to configuring postgresql.conf and pg_hba.conf in Postgres in order to be able to connect to this database from the JIRA server.  

The bamboo docs provide a nice example of the information needed and then link to the postgres documentation on this, see [Connecting Bamboo to PostgreSQL - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/postgresql-289276816.html]
fields.summary: Connecting JIRA to Postgres doc should provide more details on postgresql.conf and pg_hba.conf
Inline 'preformatted' style should work like 'noformat' block

fields.description:
h3. Preconditions

JIRA instance with at least 2 projects available, where users got permissions necessary to browse and edit/move issues.
h3. Steps to reproduce
h4. Scenario 1:
 # Open an issue in project A
 # Use Move dialog to move the issue to another project, e.g. project B

h4. Scenario 2:
 # In ProjectA have a linked issue to an issue in ProjectB
 # Click on the linked issue in ProjectA.

h3. Result

h4. Scenario 1:
Issue key got updated, however project sidebar stills show the old project (i.e. project A)

h4. Scenario 2:
The link opens the issue in ProjectB but the side navigation bar still shows project A. 
 Open this in a new tab, the navigation bar will show ProjectB
  
h3. Expected Result
h4. Scenario 1

Since issue data got reloaded, project sidebar shows information for the target project (i.e. project B)
h4. Scenario 2

The navigation bar should be showing information for Project B instead of Project A
fields.summary: Reload issue changes does not reload project sidebar
